nodes.bodyText: This is a stupidly long line
You could save some intention and just negate + return.
Don't do a fucking containsKey and a get. A containsKey literally is a get anyway
Again, get after a containsKey. Slowing this down for no reason
What the hell is the point of this listener...
To allow for other addons to add more materials before actually applying the new velocity.
This wont do shit for other addons though???? They can listen if they want. You doing this does literally nothing
Why is the unit test item in here...
Because a player cannot have a velocity in MockBukkit. so p.getVelocity() just throws an exception when used in a test.
That's a stupidly bad hacky workaround. Just PR the simple patch to MockBukkit and note that this PR is blocked by that one.
I very much like the Addition of this Event but it should also include a reference to the corresponding ClimbingPick that was used, in case there may be multiple kinds in the future.
Also this should extend PlayerEvent, since it features a Player.
Missing @Override annotation.

For Velocity, we should probably also add a setter, since that's something that may be fun to play around with.
Should also add a Validate.notNull(v, ...) check in that setter then though.
You should keep ExplosivePickaxe too there.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@
  * 
  * @author Linox
  * 
- * @see ExplosivePickaxe
+ * @see ExplosiveTool

nodes.bodyText: Removing this is quite a bad idea, you should always use the primitive boolean here instead of boxing it.
Why even? This method does literally nothing.
It does. Without this the handlerset inside the publicItemHandlers doesn't change. I know this because I tested it.
This should be moved below the overloaded method.
Please don't use a static variable for this, use a seperate item for every test.
This should very well be a parameterized test instead of using a BlockFace for loop here.
The ItemStack and Block of this Event may be good to have too.
ItemStack is ClimbingPick anyway?
No, ClimbingPick is a SlimefunItem, not the actual ItemStack that was used.

Just an enhancement idea:
Implement RecipeDisplayItem and list the blocks that can be climbed in the guide below.
Do not use ItemSetting for complex data types, such as a Map...
How can I fix this?
By removing this ItemSetting.
Why this special case?
Don't box this double, use the primitive value and use getOrDefault.
You made this a cancellable event, yet you don't listen for whether it was cancelled.
I find this addition rather useless, people should be able to use it to mine too. Is ee no reason why this would be a problem.
your suggestion said that...
No need for the D, floating point numbers are doubles by default.

Why are you doing .name() here?
Should really just store the Enum and even better: Use an EnumMap<>
This is much more cleaner and better storage-wise.

yeah but when they are printed to the config sth like "!Material.ANDESITE :" is printed
this is completely for aesthetics in items.yml
Can just use 1, no need for the D here.
nah can't because the map has it Double
it only accepts double values
Why Concrete Powder?
Thought they may be nice to be able to climbed. Also I thought this pick can be used in parkour maps so a bit color options for them?
I find this Enderman sound a bit inappropriate here, the Player isn't getting teleported. They're climbing.

Why 4?
Why asynchronously? If you are accessing this Set asynchronously, you should absolutely use a thread-safe implementation like ConcurrentSet.
I tested and 4 is the most ideal to actually climb. After 5-6 ticks the player starts to fall down.
ah that needs to be sync...
Again, this .replace() call is completely unnecessary here, the Set is already from the Hashmap and computed otherwise, adding it to the Set itself is enough, this is a wasteful call.
You made a Pull Request for it, so wait till that is merged instead of disabling this.
Yeah but I don't have much time left so I just want to be done with these prs

You know... you also could have just done
shouldCancel = face == BlockFace.DOWN || face == BlockFace.UP
...
You can remove the D here, it's redundant. You can just use 1.

Please use the actual Materials and not .name() ...
You should also use an EnumMap for this.
Remove this line.

This is a really badly done lore.
First of all, you should not change the name... The user should see what Block they can climb. Just do new ItemStack(mat) instead.
When implementing this, you should also override the label method and add a new string to the language file, since it would otherwise say "These recipes can be crafted in this machine" by default.
